page.title: 11THE FLORA OF PENNARD.
page.content: MOST OF THE FLOWERS IN OUR SCHOOL GROUNDS ARE DAISIES AND DANDELIONS .WE FOUND A LOT OF OTHER FLOWERS IN THE HEDGEROW. WE FOUND CHUMPREY, WILD ROSE, YARROW, DOG DAISY, SHEEP'S SORREL FOOLS PARSLEY, HARESFOOT CLOVER AND NETTLES. AROUND PENNARD THERE ARE LOTS OF WILD FLOWERS. WHEN WE WENT FOR A WALK ON THE CLIFF WE PICKED QUITE A LOT OF FLOWERS AND PLANTS. WE FOUND SOME HERB ROBERT WHEN WE WERE WALKING ON THE CLIFF. WE SAW SOME HONEYSUCKLE, CLOVER AND GIANT BINDWEED. ON THE WAY BACK WE SAW SOME LUPINS AND SPEEDWELL. THE FLOWERS WE FOUND ON THE CLIFFS DID NOT HAVE VERY LONG STEMS. WE FOUND MOST OF THE FLOWERS IN SANDY SOIL. ON THE CLIFFS THERE WERE NO TREES BUT THERE WERE LOTS OF GORSE BUSHES, BRAMBLES AND ELDER BUSHES. THEY ALL GREW VERY LOW TO THE GROUND.
